name: json-to-html
readme: # json-to-html Convert JSON Object to HTML. ## Installation npm install json-to-html ## Usage ```javascript var json2html = require('json-to-html') , html = json2html({ 'hello': 'world' }); console.log(html); ``` output: ```html { "hello": "world" } ``` 2 space indentation is default. Change it by adding a numeric argument to `json2html`. ```javascript var html = json2html(object, 4); ``` Every operand has a span added around it self with different classnames. `string`, `boolean`, `number` or `null`. ## License See [MIT-LICENSE](https://github.com/frozzare/json-to-html/blob/master/MIT-LICENSE)
